rationale: It is only known from one location, the type locality Kasewe (Sierra Leone) according to Paugy et al. (2003) and possibly in a second locality in Liberia according to FishBase. The estimated extent of occurrence and area of occupancy are less than 5,000 km² and less than 500 km², respectively. The extent and quality of habitat is undergoing and continuous decline due to mining, urban and deforestation developments. The species is therefore assessed as Endangered.
evaluator: Entsua-Mensah, M., Darwall, W. & Smith, K.
